business.headline: Amazon to lay off 370 staff in Luxembourg. What's driving the job cuts?Amazon employs about 4,370 people in Luxembourg, and the planned cuts will affect nearly 8.5% of its workforce there.

Worst behind us, IndiGo CEO tells staff after days of flight cancellations chaosAfter days of cancellation chaos, IndiGo said it has stabilised operations and restored its network to about 2,200 flights a day. Meanwhile, CEO Pieter Elbers has blamed the disruption on a compounding effect of several factors.

Why Ola Electric's Bhavish Aggarwal is selling stake as shares hit 52-week lowThe immediate reason for the latest fall of Ola Electric has been Bhavish Aggarwal's back‑to‑back selling of the stock in the open market over two days, worth well over Rs 200 crore in total.
Explained: Why Ola Electric shares fell 4% to hit 52-week low todayOla Electric share price: The stock hit a low of Rs 31.54 on December 18, marking its weakest level since listing.

55,000% rally in Indian AI stock triggers bubble concerns: ReportA little-known Indian company has delivered a stunning 55,000% rise in just under two years, raising serious questions about hype, regulation and investor risk.
Sensex opens 189 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; Infosys up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 87.06 points to 84,472.59, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 24.30 points to 25,794.25 as of 9:28 am.

ICICI Prudential AMC IPO GMP today: Is market hinting at listing gains tomorrow?The IPO allotment was finalised on Wednesday, following heavy demand from institutional investors over the three-day subscription window.

India eases visa process for foreign professionals, engineers hired by firmsIndia has introduced a simplified e-B-4 visa process to facilitate foreign experts' entry for manufacturing projects. The move aims to reduce visa processing time and support faster industrial execution.

Warner Bros rejects Paramount's $108-billion hostile bid, Netflix in raceThe board said Netflix's $27.75-per-share binding merger offers greater certainty, stronger finances and lower risk for shareholders.

From Walmart to Reliance: Meet the world's 10 richest familiesFrom retail giants to oil empires, the world's richest families control businesses that shape global markets. Let's look at the 10 richest families globally, with the Ambani family representing India.
Sensex ends 120 points lower, Nifty below 25,900; SBI gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 120.21 points to close at 84,559.65, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 41.55 points to end at 25,818.55.

Zero GST on health insurance: What it means for your premium and your pocketFrom September 22, individual health and life insurance policies have become free from Goods and Services Tax, removing the 18% tax that policyholders were paying earlier.

8th Pay Commission: When will it be implemented and how much can you expect?The 8th Pay Commission has officially been set up, but the big questions remain unanswered. When will the new pay structure be implemented, and how much of a salary hike can central government employees realistically expect?

Silver rates reach new high: Why is it beating gold prices, and should you buy?On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), silver jumped over 4% during early trade. Around 9:20 am, MCX silver was trading 3.38% higher at Rs 2,04,445 per kg, touching a lifetime high.

What is the 70% salary rule and where the other 30% should go?Abhishek Walia urges individuals to base their spending only on verified take-home pay, warning that relying on bonuses or predicted increments leads to financial stress.

Planning to exit NPS? Here's how the new rules affect your retirement payoutThe pension regulator has eased NPS exit rules, allowing subscribers to access more of their money upfront. If retirement is around the corner, these changes could directly impact your final payout.

Vedanta shares in focus as it gets NCLT approval for demerger. Check detailsVedanta share price: The approval clears a key legal hurdle and allows the company to move ahead with splitting its businesses into multiple listed entities.
Sensex, Nifty open marginally higher as banking stocks rally in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up by 91.32 points to 84,771.18, while the NSE Nifty50 added 44.40 points to 25,904.50 as of 9:22 am.
Bharat Taxi app to launch in Delhi from January 1The app is expected to provide relief to passengers who often face sharp fare increases on platforms such as Ola and Uber during peak hours.

Warner Bros likely to skip Paramount's $108.4 billion bid, back Netflix: ReportIf the board moves ahead with this recommendation, it would signal Warner Bros Discovery's preference to back Netflix's earlier buyout proposal instead of Paramount's all-cash offer.

entertainment.headline: Rob Reiner's family issues first statement as Nick faces murder trial The children of Rob and Michele Reiner have issued a statement following the deaths of their parents, as their brother Nick Reiner appears in court charged with murder. Nick's arraignment has been postponed to January 7, amid ongoing legal proceedings.
Ishaan Khatter reflects on Hollywood work culture Ishaan Khatter discussed the contrasting approaches to entourage culture and cost control in Indian and international film productions.

Big B cites astrology for Ikkis new release date, rules out Dhurandhar as reason Amitabh Bachchan reveals Agastya Nanda's debut film Ikkis has been shifted to January 1, citing astrology behind the release date change.

Dhurandhar becomes 1st Hindi film with full soundtrack on Spotify Global Top 200 All eleven tracks from Aditya Dhar's spy thriller Dhurandhar have entered the Spotify Global Top 200, marking the first time an entire Bollywood album has charted simultaneously on the international platform.

Rapper Flipperachi hopes to watch Dhurandhar despite Middle East ban on film Rapper Flipperachi has voiced his desire to watch Dhurandhar, which is currently banned in several Middle Eastern countries. He highlighted his admiration for Akshaye Khanna and Ranveer Singh, and discussed the film's viral soundtrack FA9LA.

Prime Video, ZEE5, JioHotstar: Four More Shots 4, Mrs Deshpande and more Prime Video, ZEE5 and JioHotstar are set to drop a diverse lineup of new releases on December 19, ranging from the return of Four More Shots Please! Season 4 to gripping crime and psychological thrillers.

Javed Akhtar challenges burqa logic, asks why be ashamed of your face? At the SOA Literary Festival 2025 in Bhubaneswar, celebrated lyricist Javed Akhtar responded to a student's question about women wearing burqas, sparking discussion on social pressure, choice, and dignity in personal attire.

How My Hero Academia's inclusivity-driven plot made it popular across the world The series draws parallels with pressing societal issues relevant across the world. This inclusive approach lets the series connect universally.

Netflix this week: Raat Akeli Hai, Emily in Paris 5 and more With a packed slate of new releases across genres, Netflix's lineup this week ensures plenty of compelling viewing options leading into the holiday season.

Rekha had Amitabh in vision, sceptical about Mukesh Agarwal initially: Bina Ramani Fashion designer Bina Ramani shared her perspective on Rekha's decision to marry Mukesh Aggarwal and the actor's feelings for Bollywood icon Amitabh Bachchan.

Dileep's box office trial: What works for and against Bha Bha Ba Dileep's film Bha Bha Ba released on December 18 amid mixed public sentiments following his acquittal. The film's performance, especially opening weekend, could decide his future as a leading Malayalam star.

Worse than hyenas: Actor Nidhhi Agerwal swarmed by vulture-like crowd at event Actress Nidhhi Agerwal was mobbed while exiting The Raja Saab song launch in Hyderabad, leading to concern among fans and netizens about safety and event management.

Cause of death confirmed for Rob and Michele Reiner days after murders The official cause of death for filmmaker Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele, has been confirmed, with their son Nick Reiner charged with two counts of first-degree murder.

Nick Reiner makes first court appearance in parents' murder case Nick Reiner made his first court appearance on Wednesday morning, facing charges for the murder of his parents, Rob and Michele Reiner.

Avatar: Fire and Ash review: A visual inferno trapped in emotional ashRelease Date:Fri Dec 19, 2025 The scale is immense, the imagery overwhelming, and the ambition of Avatar: Fire and Ash is unmistakable. The storyline, though emotionally effective, is predictable.

Oscars moving to YouTube in 2029, will stream free worldwide The Oscars will transition to exclusive global streaming on YouTube starting in 2029, ending their decades-long broadcast partnership with ABC.

Preity Zinta gives shout-out to Mukesh Chhabra for Dhurandhar casting Preity Zinta shared a post and praised casting director Mukesh Chhabra for his impressive work in 'Dhurandhar'. The film is currently running successfully in theatres.

The awful producers didn't put me up, didn't pay me: Radhika Apte on debut film Radhika Apte reflected on her difficult experience during the making of her debut film 'Vaah! Life Ho Toh Aisi!', describing issues with the producers and contract process, as well as highlighting positive interactions with Mahesh Manjrekar.

Watch: John Abraham celebrates 53rd birthday with fans and paparazzi John Abraham marked his 53rd birthday by celebrating with fans and photographers. Pictures and videos of the actor celebrating the same have gone viral.

general news.headline: Delhi air crisis: No fuel without PUC certificate, no entry for old cars from todayPetrol pumps across Delhi have stopped dispensing fuel to vehicles that do not possess valid Pollution Under Control (PUC) certificates. The rule is being implemented using automatic number plate recognition (ANPR) cameras, voice alert systems at petrol pumps, and support from Delhi Police personnel.

Over 2 lakh Indians giving up citizenship each year. What's behind the exodus?The Ministry of External Affairs told the Parliament that over nine lakh Indians have given up their citizenship in the last 5 years, with over 2 lakh per year since 2022. Why are Indians renouncing citizenship in record numbers?

Room 315, fast food: What Bondi terrorists did in Philippines hotel for a monthThe two terrorists who killed 15 civilians at Australia's Bondi Beach travelled to the Philippines in November. For almost a month, Sajid Akram and his son Naveed spent most of the time in room 315 of GV Hotel in Davao city in southern Philippines. The room was sparsely furnished and hotel staff recount a quiet routine of the duo.

May never see him again: Imran Khan's sons describe 'awful' jail conditionsImran Khan's sons, in an interview with Sky News, said the former Pakistani PM was being 'psychologically tortured' in a 'death cell' and feared that they might never see him again.

Worse than hyenas: Actor Nidhhi Agerwal swarmed by vulture-like crowd at eventActress Nidhhi Agerwal was mobbed while exiting The Raja Saab song launch in Hyderabad, leading to concern among fans and netizens about safety and event management.

Meanwhile, CEO Pieter Elbers has blamed the disruption on a compounding effect of several factors.

Maharashtra village of just 1,500 sees over 27,000 'births' in 3 monthsAn investigation found that the birth and death registration system of the village in Maharashtra's Yavatmal had been compromised. The BJP said 99% of the names found in the entries belong to people from Bengal and Uttar Pradesh.

Sleepy Joe, divisive Obama: Trump's Presidential Walk of Fame mocks predecessorsThe White House unveiled Donald Trump's Presidential Walk of Fame, featuring plaques that mock Joe Biden and Barack Obama and others and credit the US President's achievements.

Live: House resumes for Day 14, Delhi-NCR air crisis in focusParliament Winter Session Live Updates: The Parliament has begun for Day 14, and a discussion is set to be held on the deteriorating air quality in Delhi and the National Capital Region. The detailed discussion will happen following concerns raised by several Opposition members in both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha. Environment Minister Bhupendra Yadav is scheduled to reply to queries, objections and suggestions in Parliament at around 6 pm. Meanwhile, on Wednesday, Lok Sabha passed the Shanti bill, and now it will be up for debate in Rajya Sabha.

Santa behosh ho gaye: AAP's skit to mock BJP over Delhi air pollutionThe video was released on a day Delhi's air quality remained in the "very poor" category, with the Air Quality Index recorded at 358, according to official pollution control data.

Dhurandhar becomes 1st Hindi film with full soundtrack on Spotify Global Top 200All eleven tracks from Aditya Dhar's spy thriller Dhurandhar have entered the Spotify Global Top 200, marking the first time an entire Bollywood album has charted simultaneously on the international platform.

Ashes Snicko controversy erupts again: Stokes left fuming at Jamie Smith's dismissalEngland were left fuming in Adelaide after Jamie Smith was controversially given out despite replays showing daylight between bat and ball, putting the Snicko technology under scrutiny in the third Ashes Test.

China builds secret 'Manhattan Project', challenging West's AI chip monopolyThe breakthrough marks the culmination of a six-year government initiative to achieve semiconductor self-sufficiency, one of President Xi Jinping's highest priorities.

Ended 8 wars in 10 months: Trump at it again, credits favourite word 'tariffs'During his address to the nation, US President Donald Trump credited his "favourite word" in English language 'tariffs' behind successfully "ending eight wars in 10 months". He insisted tariffs were boosting the American economy despite his falling popularity and skyrocketing inflation.

Career minimalism is Gen Z's way to escape hustle culture. But what is it?Gen Z is no longer chasing professional goals blindly; they are working with intention, choosing roles that align with their personal values, mental well-being, and long-term financial stability.

How Delhi's solid ground could turn into liquid during a big quakeIndia's 2025 earthquake code mandates strict liquefaction checks to prevent buildings from sinking in Delhi's soft soil. These rigorous new mathematical tests will safeguard millions across the Indo-Gangetic Plain.

Bride fixed critical tech bug 10 minutes after wedding, says brother, shares picKoyalAI co-founder Gauri Agarwal fixed a critical bug just 10 minutes after her wedding ceremony, a moment that was captured and shared on social media by her brother.

What the smog! Visibility low, common sense lower in Lucknow T20I fiascoIND vs SA: Fans waited more than three hours during the India vs South Africa 4th T20I for a toss that never came. In Lucknow, the BCCI once again left spectators aggrieved in what many saw as a shameful handling of the situation.

Avatar: Fire and Ash review: A visual inferno trapped in emotional ashRelease Date:Fri Dec 19, 2025The scale is immense, the imagery overwhelming, and the ambition of Avatar: Fire and Ash is unmistakable. The storyline, though emotionally effective, is predictable.

CLAT 2026 AIR 1 Geetali Gupta breaks down in tears after seeing her resultA video capturing CLAT 2026 topper Geetali Gupta's heartfelt response to her results has resonated online, showing her tearful joy and family support after securing the top rank.

Seagull with Chinese GPS tracker found near key naval base in KarnatakaOfficials found that the GPS tracker, which was attached to the seagull's back, belonged to a research centre under the Chinese Academy of Sciences. The bird was found along the Karwar coast, close to the INS Kadamba naval base.

Mehul Choksi to be extradited to India as Belgian court rejects torture claimOne of Mehul Choksi's main arguments was that, if extradited, he faced a real risk of torture or inhuman treatment at the hands of investigative agencies. However, the Belgian Supreme Court rejected the argument.

Winning Test series in Australia harder than getting Olympic gold: Monty PanesarMonty Panesar recently caught up with India Today.in to discuss what all has gone wrong for Ben Stokes and his men in the ongoing Ashes. He also touched upon his banter with Steve Smith and revealed why he feels winning in Australia is far more difficult than winning an Olympic Gold.

sports.headline: Sachin Tendulkar honours India's World Cup winning women's blind cricket team Legendary cricketer Sachin Tendulkar met India's women's blind cricket team to honour their historic World Cup victory. India beat Nepal to clinch the inaugural women's world cup for the blind in Sri Lanka.

Joe Burns axed from Italy's maiden T20 World Cup after internal dispute: Report Joe Burns' shock omission from Italy's T20 World Cup 2026 squad has sparked controversy, with the former captain claiming he was pushed out after challenging cricket standards and off-field processes.

Ashes Snicko controversy erupts again: Stokes left fuming at Jamie Smith's dismissal England were left fuming in Adelaide after Jamie Smith was controversially given out despite replays showing daylight between bat and ball, putting the Snicko technology under scrutiny in the third Ashes Test.

Pat Cummins scalps Joe Root again: Australia skipper goes past Bumrah in key battle Australia skipper Pat Cummins struck early to dismiss England's Joe Root again in the Ashes. The Adelaide wicket took Cummins clear as the bowler to have removed England's batting star most times in Tests.

Thanks to Steve Smith, he made me famous: Monty Panesar Former England spinner Monty Panesar has taken another swipe at Australian batter Steve Smith, saying that Smith helped make him famous through their banter ahead of the Ashes 2025–26. Panesar had earlier suggested that the English media and fans should target Smith and remind him of his involvement in the Cape Town ball-tampering scandal. However, Smith responded by digging out an embarrassing video of Panesar's appearance on a quiz show.

Winning Test series in Australia harder than getting Olympic gold: Monty Panesar Monty Panesar recently caught up with India Today.in to discuss what all has gone wrong for Ben Stokes and his men in the ongoing Ashes. He also touched upon his banter with Steve Smith and revealed why he feels winning in Australia is far more difficult than winning an Olympic Gold.

Watch: Glenn McGrath jokingly throws chair as Nathan Lyon surpasses his Test record Australia spinner Nathan Lyon moved past Glenn McGrath on the Test wickets list during the Ashes, Adelaide Test. McGrath's light-hearted reaction summed up the moment as Lyon climbed to sixth all-time.

India vs South Africa T20 Abandoned in Lucknow Due to Smog, Sparks Political Row A scheduled T20 cricket match between India and South Africa in Lucknow was abandoned without a ball being bowled due to excessive smog. The toss was delayed multiple times before officials called off the game citing poor visibility. The incident has sparked a political row, with opposition leaders criticizing the administration for the worsening air quality and suggesting alternative venues. The event highlights the growing environmental crisis affecting major cities beyond the national capital.

SMAT 2025 final live streaming: All you need to know about Haryana vs Jharkhand After a three-week contest, Haryana and Jharkhand will face off in the SMAT 2025 final in Pune. The summit clash will be played from 4:30 PM IST.

ICC reinstates England review after Alex Carey snicko controversy in Ashes: Explained A Snicko error turned day one of the Ashes Test into a technology debate. After England's protest, the ICC stepped in, reinstating a review and reopening questions over cricket's reliance on technology.

Ashwin accused of leaking CSK's IPL auction picks, spinner has a funny responseIPL auction 2026: Former spinner R Ashwin responded to trolls in his inimitable style after a few on social media accused him of leaking Chennai Super Kings auction picks before the five-time champions bought those players in Abu Dhabi on Tuesday.

Will surely visit again: Watch Lionel Messi's day at Anant Ambani's VantaraLionel Messi's India tour found a soulful pause at Vantara, where football met conservation. Guided by Anant Ambani, the global icon explored India's blend of tradition and modern wildlife care.

Real Madrid still lacking consistency: coach Xabi Alonso after narrow Talavera winReal Madrid scraped past Talavera in the Copa del Rey but looked far from convincing. Xabi Alonso admitted his side still lack control and consistency despite progressing to the next round.

Injured or dropped? Fans speculate broader reason for Shubman Gill's T20I absenceShubman Gill's injury ruled him out of the Lucknow T20I, but questions around his form lingered. With India hit by injuries, selection debates intensified as the series entered a decisive phase.

What the smog! Visibility low, common sense lower in Lucknow T20I fiascoIND vs SA: Fans waited more than three hours during the India vs South Africa 4th T20I for a toss that never came. In Lucknow, the BCCI once again left spectators aggrieved in what many saw as a shameful handling of the situation.

No will to invest in Indian football but crores spent on Messi tour: JhinganStar centre-back Sandesh Jhingan posted a hard-hitting message on social media, questioning the decision to spend crores on Lionel Messi's GOAT India Tour at a time when Indian football has hit rock bottom and the Indian Super League has been indefinitely postponed due to a lack of investment.

FIFA World Cup winners to get record 50 million USD, much less than Club World CupFIFA has announced a 50 per cent increase in World Cup prize money for next year's tournament, with the champions set to take home a record $50 million (£37.5 million) for lifting the trophy.

Satwik and Chirag aim for improvement after gritty win in opening matchBWF World Tour Finals: Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty clinched a gritty win over Olympic silver medallists Liang Wei Keng and Wang Chang of China in their first group match in the season-ending tournament in Hangzhou.

T20 World Cup: Eden Gardens tickets start at Rs 100, India Super 8 game at Rs 900The Cricket Association of Bengal has revealed the ticket structure for ICC Men's T20 World Cup matches at Eden Gardens, with prices varying across group-stage and knockout fixtures.

Heartbroken, give my money back: Fans demand refund after Lucknow T20I abandonedFans in Lucknow demanded a refund after the 4th T20I between India and South Africa at the Ekana stadium was abandoned due to fog on Wednesday, December 17. The game was abandoned without the toss even happening.

Was Lucknow T20I the first time an international game was abandoned due to fog?Fog played spoilsport in Lucknow on Wednesday, December 17 as the 4th T20I between India and South Africa was abandoned without the toss even happening. Here's a look if this was the first time an international game was abandoned due to poor visibility.

Smog 1-0 cricket: 4th T20I abandoned due to poor visibility in LucknowIndia vs South Africa: The fourth T20I at Lucknow's Atal Bihari Vajpayee Stadium was abandoned due to poor visibility on a smoggy evening. The umpires inspected conditions six times before taking the final call. A section of cricket fans slammed the BCCI for scheduling a match in the city during the winter months.

Lionel Messi performs Shiv Abhishek, chants mantra in Anant Ambani's VantaraLionel Messi performed Shiv Abhishek at Anant Ambani's Vantara on Tuesday, December 16. Apart from offering prayers, Messi, along with Luis Suarez and Rodrigo de Paul, meditated in front of the Shivling as well.

DRS out, Overtake mode on: What are the new F1 regulations for 2026 seasonThe new rules and regulations for Formula One 2026 season has been revealed by the FIA on Wednesday, December 17. With no more DRS and the cars getting a bit smaller in size, expect the new season to throw a lot of curveballs to the drivers and the fans.

Carlos Alcaraz ends 7-year stint with coach, who says would have loved to continueWorld No. 1 Carlos Alcaraz and his long-time coach Juan Carlos Ferrero have ended their partnership after over seven years, marking the close of a highly successful chapter in men's tennis. Ferrero, a former No. 1 himself, said he would have loved to continue working with Alcaraz.

December T20I in Lucknow? Fans slam BCCI after dense fog delays IND vs SA clashIND vs SA, 4th T20I: Thick fog delayed India's fourth T20I match in Lucknow on Wednesday. Fans were left angry after the match did not start on time and slammed the BCCI over their poor scheduling.

Smog or fog? Hardik Pandya wears mask during training as Lucknow T20I delayedIndian all-rounder Hardik Pandya was seen wearing a face mask as dense fog blanketed the Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium, delaying the toss in the fourth T20I between India and South Africa in Lucknow.

IND vs SA: Out-of-form Shubman Gill ruled out of Lucknow T20I due to foot injuryOut-of-form Shubman Gill has been ruled out of the Lucknow T20I against South Africa due to a foot injury. Sanju Samson is expected to return to the top of the order after Gill's setback.

AFC bans Mohun Bagan SG from 2027 to 28 tournaments, imposes fineIndian Super League champions Mohun Bagan Super Giant have been banned from all AFC club competitions until the 2027–28 season and fined over USD 100,000 for refusing to travel to Iran for a scheduled group-stage match against Sepahan SC.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
